items.label: E-Visa
items.value: Apply online at visa2egypt.gov.eg (~$25, valid 30 days)

items.label: Visa on Arrival
items.value: Available at Cairo airport (~$25 cash USD/EUR/GBP)

items.label: Passport
items.value: Must be valid 6+ months from entry date

items.label: Cards
items.value: Visa/Mastercard widely accepted; most tourist sites now card-only

items.label: Cash
items.value: Still needed for taxis, tips, markets, small vendors

items.label: ATMs
items.value: Available in cities; withdraw EGP on arrival

items.label: Exchange
items.value: Better rates in Egypt than UK; airport exchange OK for small amounts

items.label: Budget tip
items.value: Set aside 10-15% of trip budget for tips

tipping.title: Tipping Guide (Baksheesh)
tipping.note: Tipping is essential in Egypt—many workers rely on it. Carry small notes (5, 10, 20, 50 EGP). Tip in Egyptian pounds (foreign coins worthless to locals). "La shukran" = "No thank you" for unwanted help.

weather.title: Weather & Packing
packing: Comfortable walking shoes (lots of uneven ground at temples)
Sunglasses, sunscreen, hat (sun is strong even in winter)
Light scarf (useful for sun, dust, mosque visits)

scams.title: Avoiding Scams

items.avoid: Use Uber/Careem apps; agree price before if street taxi
Agree TOTAL price (including getting off!) before mounting
Only use guides with official tourism badges
Research typical costs; haggling is expected in markets
Ignore anyone saying site is closed—check yourself
Taxis may take you to "cousin's shop"—decline firmly

haggling: Start at 30-50% of asking price, meet in middle
Walk away if price doesn't suit—often brings it down

connectivity.title: SIM Cards & Internet
items: Buy tourist SIM at Cairo airport (Vodafone, Orange, Etisalat)
~£10-15 for SIM + data package (~10-20GB)
Bring passport for registration
WhatsApp works well for communication
WiFi available at most hotels

health.title: Health & Safety
items: Don't drink tap water — bottled water only (cheap and everywhere)
Avoid ice in drinks outside hotels
Wash/peel fruit; be cautious with salads from street vendors
Bring basic meds: anti-diarrhoea, rehydration salts, paracetamol
Sun protection essential
Travel insurance: ensure it covers medical evacuation

emergency.title: Emergency Contacts
emergency.embassy: 7 Ahmed Ragheb Street, Garden City, Cairo

etiquette.title: Cultural Etiquette
items: Remove shoes when entering mosques
Dress modestly at religious sites (shoulders/knees covered)
Ask permission before photographing people
Use right hand for greetings and eating
Egyptians are generally warm and hospitable—a smile goes far
Bargaining is normal and expected in markets (not in restaurants/hotels)
Friday is the holy day; some sites may have reduced hours

photography.title: Photography Tips
items: Mobile phones: free at most sites
Professional cameras: may require extra fee (100-300 EGP)
No flash inside tombs (damages paintings)
Some tomb interiors ban all photography
Ask before photographing locals

transport.title: Airport Transfers

airports.name: London Heathrow (LHR) - Outbound
tips: Terminal 2 is the Queen's Terminal — Heathrow Express stops here

airports.name: Cairo Airport (CAI)

options.notes: Best option. Book in app, pay by card or cash
Fixed price booth inside arrivals; slightly pricier but reliable
Negotiate firmly before getting in; avoid touts

tips: Uber/Careem pickup is at the car park (follow signs or ask)
Traffic is brutal 7-10am and 4-8pm — allow extra time
Have hotel address in Arabic on phone to show driver

airports.name: Aswan Airport (ASW)

options.notes: Best option — Kana Kato can arrange; includes ferry
Then take local ferry (5-10 EGP) or hotel boat

tips: Arrange pickup with Kana Kato in advance — they meet you at the dock
Aswan airport is small; taxis wait outside arrivals
Agree on price before getting in if using taxi

airports.name: Hurghada Airport (HRG)

options.notes: Official booth at airport; fixed price

tips: Check-in closes 60 mins before easyJet departure

general: Uber and Careem (Middle East Uber) work in major cities — pay by card or cash
Always confirm destination before starting journey
Screenshot your hotel address in Arabic
For early morning flights, book hotel transfer night before
